meanings.definition: A race or competition in which team members take turns participating.
meanings.sent1: During the relay, each runner passed the baton to the next teammate.
meanings.sent2: The school organized a relay race for the students to participate in.
meanings.sent3: In the relay, the turtle surprisingly outran the hare!
meanings.sent4: The relay was like a well-oiled machine, with each member seamlessly passing the baton.
meanings.sent5: The relay race was so exciting that the audience cheered loudly for their favorite team.

meanings.definition: To pass along or transfer information or a message.
meanings.sent1: Can you relay the message to your friend for me?
meanings.sent2: I will relay the instructions to the rest of the team.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to relay the secret but got distracted by a shiny object.
meanings.sent4: She relayed the news to her family, causing a wave of excitement.
meanings.sent5: The phone line was clear, allowing her to relay the information quickly.

meanings.definition: A device used to control the flow of electricity in a circuit.
meanings.sent1: The engineer installed a new relay in the electrical system.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to check the relay to ensure the circuit functions properly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the relay for a nut and tried to bury it.
meanings.sent4: The relay acted as a gatekeeper, regulating the electricity flow efficiently.
meanings.sent5: Without the relay, the circuit would be unable to manage the power distribution.
